item.title: Report E-2025040502
item.description:
Report E-2025040502

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-22
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 50ft-by-10ft of the asphalt parking lot 20ft-by-5ft of the trailer floor and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to hard brake incident that caused a load shift resulting in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum becoming crushed. First Call Environmental personnel deployed neutralizers to the impacted areas and then used a granular absorbent to recover the neutralized material. The remaining product in the damaged drum was neutralized and containerized along with the recovered spent material into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged empty drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
